parameters.description: object name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant

parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header UUID
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant-UUID

parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. If unset, the version will be defaulted to 16.4.3. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.
parameters.name: X-Avi-Version

parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.
parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.name: body

parameters.name: uuid

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.
parameters.name: join_subresources

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid
parameters.name: refers_to

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid
parameters.name: referred_by

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.

latitude.description: Latitude of the location. This is represented as degrees.minutes. The range is from -90.0 (south) to +90.0 (north). Allowed values are -90.0-+90.0. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

tag.description: Location tag string - example  USEast. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

name.description: Location name in the format Country/State/City. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

longitude.description: Longitude of the location. This is represented as degrees.minutes. The range is from -180.0 (west) to +180.0 (east). Allowed values are -180.0-+180.0. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

begin.description: Starting IP address of the range.

end.description: Ending IP address of the range.

domain_name.description: GSLB subdomain used for GSLB service FQDN match and placement. .

site_uuid.description: This field identifies the site that will health monitor on behalf of the current site. i.e. it will be a health monitor proxy and monitor members of the current site. . Field introduced in 17.1.1.

proxy_type.description: This field identifies the health monitor proxy behavior. The designated site for health monitor proxy can monitor public or private or all the members of a given site. . Enum options - GSLB_HEALTH_MONITOR_PROXY_ALL_MEMBERS, GSLB_HEALTH_MONITOR_PROXY_PRIVATE_MEMBERS. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

prefixes.description: Configure IP address prefix(es). Field introduced in 17.1.2.

ranges.description: Configure IP address range(s). Field introduced in 17.1.2.

type.description: Specify whether this client IP address range is public or private. Enum options - GSLB_IP_PUBLIC, GSLB_IP_PRIVATE. Field introduced in 17.1.2.

addrs.description: Configure IP address(es). Field introduced in 17.1.2.

ip_addr.description: Placeholder for description of property ip_addr of obj type IpAddrPrefix field type str  type object

dns_vs_uuids.description: The DNS VSes on which the GslbServices shall be placed. The site has to be an ACTIVE member.  This field is deprecated in 17.2.3 and replaced by 'dns_vses' field. . Field deprecated in 17.2.3.

username.description: The username used when authenticating with the Site. .

ratio.description: User can overide the individual GslbPoolMember ratio for all the VIPs/VS(es) of this site. If this field is not  configured then the GslbPoolMember ratio gets applied. . Allowed values are 1-20. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

name.description: Name for the Site Controller Cluster.

ip_addresses.description: IP Address(es) of the Site's Cluster. For a 3-node cluster, either the cluster vIP is provided, or the list of controller IPs in the cluster are provided.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the Site.  This is useful in maintenance scenarios such as upgrade and routine maintenance.  A disabled site's configuration shall be retained but it will not get any new configuration updates.  It shall not participate in Health-Status monitoring.  VIPs of the Virtual Services on the disabled site shall not be sent in DNS response.  When a site transitions from disabled to enabled, it is treated similar to the addition of a new site.

member_type.description: The site's member type  A leader is set to ACTIVE while allmembers are set to passive. . Enum options - GSLB_ACTIVE_MEMBER, GSLB_PASSIVE_MEMBER.

location.description: Geographic location of the site. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

hm_proxies.description: User can designate certain Avi sites to run health monitor probes for VIPs/VS(es) for this site. This is useful in network deployments where the VIPs/VS(es) are reachable only from certain sites. A typical scenario is a firewall between two GSLB sites. User may want to run health monitor probes from sites on either side of the firewall so that each designated site can derive a datapath view of the reachable members. If the health monitor proxies are not configured, then the default behavior is to run health monitor probes from all the active sites. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

address.description: IP Address or a DNS resolvable, fully qualified domain name of the Site Controller Cluster.

cluster_uuid.description: UUID of the 'Cluster' object of the Controller Cluster in this site.

dns_vses.description: This field identifies the DNS VS and the subdomains it hosts for Gslb services. . Field introduced in 17.2.3.

password.description: The password used when authenticating with the Site.

port.description: The Site Controller Cluster's REST API port number. Allowed values are 1-65535.

ratio.description: User can overide the individual GslbPoolMember ratio for all the VIPs of this site. If this field is not configured, then the GslbPoolMember ratio gets applied. . Allowed values are 1-20. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

name.description: Name of the third-party Site. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

hm_proxies.description: User can designate certain Avi sites to run health monitor probes for VIPs/VS(es) for this site. This is useful in network deployments where the VIPs/VS(es) are reachable only from certain sites. A typical scenario is a firewall between two GSLB sites. User may want to run health monitor probes from sites on either side of the firewall so that each designated site can derive a datapath view of the reachable members. If the health monitor proxies are not configured, then the default behavior is to run health monitor probes from all the active sites. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

cluster_uuid.description: Third-party-site identifier generated by Avi. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the third-party Site.  This is useful in maintenance scenarios such as upgrade and routine maintenance. A disabled site's configuration shall be retained  but it will not get any new configuration updates.   VIPs associated with the disabled site shall not be sent in DNS response. . Field introduced in 17.1.1.

location.description: Geographic location of the site. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

maintenance_mode.description: This field disables the configuration operations on the leader for all federated objects.  CUD operations on Gslb, GslbService, GslbGeoDbProfile and other federated objects will be rejected. The rest-api disabling helps in upgrade scenarios where we don't want configuration sync operations to the Gslb member when the member is being upgraded.  This configuration programmatically blocks the leader from accepting new Gslb configuration when member sites are undergoing upgrade. . Field introduced in 17.2.1.

third_party_sites.description: Third party site member belonging to this Gslb. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Tenant.

is_federated.description: This field indicates that this object is replicated across GSLB federation. Field introduced in 17.1.3.

sites.description: Select Avi site member belonging to this Gslb.

send_interval.description: Frequency with which group members communicate. Allowed values are 1-3600.

clear_on_max_retries.description: Max retries after which the remote site is treated as a fresh start. In fresh start all the configs are downloaded. Allowed values are 1-1024.

dns_configs.description: Sub domain configuration for the GSLB.  GSLB service's FQDN must be a match one of these subdomains. .

leader_cluster_uuid.description: Mark this Site as leader of GSLB configuration. This site is the one among the Avi sites.

client_ip_addr_group.description: Group to specify if the client ip addresses are public or private. Field introduced in 17.1.2.

view_id.description: The view-id is used in change-leader mode to differentiate partitioned groups while they have the same GSLB namespace. Each partitioned group will be able to operate independently by using the view-id.

description.description: User defined description for the object.

source.description: This field describes the source of the GeoLocation. . Enum options - GSLB_LOCATION_SRC_USER_CONFIGURED, GSLB_LOCATION_SRC_INHERIT_FROM_SITE, GSLB_LOCATION_SRC_FROM_GEODB. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

location.description: Geographic location of the site. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

domain_names.description: This field identifies the subdomains that are hosted on the DNS VS. GslbService(s) whose FQDNs map to one of the subdomains will be hosted on this DNS VS. If no subdomains are configured, then the default behavior is to host all the GslbServices on this DNS VS. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

dns_vs_uuid.description: This field identifies the DNS VS uuid for this site. Field introduced in 17.2.3.
